TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
Hiya guys! I read Xannari Ferrows’ comment and I have to agree with him, How was y’alls day today ? Why is the age limit for the Moderator position 18? Another question how can I see the screen that is showed in the beginning of the Scott Manley docking video? What is beyond the rest of the solar system?

P.S. I play on the Xbox version of KSP so if you could give me the keys in that form that would be amazing.

**Edited <time datetime="2019-03-26T13:34:22Z" title="03/26/2019 01:34  PM" data-short="5 yr">March 26, 2019</time> by Mikenike**

> 
> 
> 10 hours ago, Mikenike said:
> 
> 
> How was y’alls day today ?
> 

I've had better.

> 
> 
> 10 hours ago, Mikenike said:
>

> Why is the age limit for the Moderator position 18?
> 

Because of Legal reasons. 

> 
> 
> 10 hours ago, Mikenike said:
> 
> 
> Another question how can I see the screen that is showed in the beginning of the Scott Manley docking video?
> 

Probably hit pause during the beginning of the video.   ???

> 
> 
> 10 hours ago, Mikenike said:
> 
> 
> What is beyond the rest of the solar system?
> 

IRL or In game? 

Answer is the same, it's turtles all the way.....

Gragamel, as much as I love sarcasm it wasn’t really needed. I meant in game for the video thing and for beyond the solar system part I meant in game. Also how did you make it to a Moderator position if you have that extremely sour attitude towards everyone on here?

> 
> 
> 51 minutes ago, Mikenike said:
> 
> 
> Hiya guys! I read Xannari Ferrows’ comment and I have to agree with him, How was y’alls day today ? Why is the age limit for the Moderator position 18? Another question how can I see the screen that is showed in the beginning of the Scott Manley docking video? What is beyond the rest of the solar system?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> P.S. I play on the Xbox version of KSP so if you could give me the keys in that form that would be amazing.
> 

[@Mikenike](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/196142-mikenike/),

To answer your question about anything beyond the solar system, the answer is **nothing**. There's nothing beyond the stock planets in the unmodded KSP. This is why so many folks (including myself) use mods to make it more interesting and to have the "deep space exploration" ability.

Once you've downloaded and installed [Kopernicus](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/181547-161-2-backports-kopernicus-kittopiatech/&tab=comments#comment-2602496), there's a whole host of other mods which will become usable in your game. Some add planets to the Kerbol system, such as Outer Planet Mods, while others add entire new solar systems "out in space."

Here's the first mod you will need to install to make any of the planet packs or solar system packs work:

<iframe allowfullscreen="" data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" data-embedcontent="" data-embedid="embed4478414112" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/181547-161-2-backports-kopernicus-kittopiatech/&tab=comments&do=embed&comment=2602496&embedComment=2602496&embedDo=findComment#comment-2602496" style="height:313px;max-width:502px;"></iframe>

I hope this helps to steer you in the right direction. If you have any additional questions, do not hesitate to let us know.
Adsii, I am sorry but I play on Xbox one’s EE version so the mod (unless I can find it as an app on the store) is sadly useless to me.

> 
> 
> 8 minutes ago, Mikenike said:
> 
> 
> Adsii, I am sorry but I play on Xbox one’s EE version so the mod (unless I can find it as an app on the store) is sadly useless to me.
> 

Yeah, I just went back and read your initial post about you being on console. However, the concept of going beyond the system doesn't have to remain boring or an excursion into nothingness. Now I am not familiar enough to know how the console game works, but back when the PC version was .24, I actually made a "Deep Space K" space station way out. I mean, it would take three hours of x4 speed to travel to it. It gave me lots of practice with intercept nodes, docking, course correction burns, etc.

Might that be possible in the console version of the game? You may not be able to go as far out as I could on PC, but even one that's out there some distance could be fun.
Yeah you’re right adsii, I should do a deep space station, got any ideas on the DSS and what I should launch it with? Also did you use a small set of docking drones to practice docking?

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, Mikenike said:
> 
> 
> Yeah you’re right adsii, I should do a deep space station, got any ideas on the DSS and what I should launch it with? Also did you use a small set of docking drones to practice docking?
> 

Rather than do a lengthy response which would be *off topic* here, I sent you a PM with what I did. I do hope it helps and inspires.
Thanks again man really appreciated

>

> 9 hours ago, Mikenike said:
> 
> 
> I meant in game for the video thing
> 

Ah, well, without any context, it's very difficult to know which video you are referring to, he's made *a lot* of videos.  Perhaps you would like to provide some links and help us out some? 

And I'm pretty sure it's turtles IRL and in the game.    But the only way to know is to head out there and find out.  ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")
